name: Hotel Riu Palace Riviera Maya

reviews.text: Other reviews complained about the evening entertainment being pretty weak, they were being kind. It was awful, and that's a shame. Every night there would be 150-200 really well dressed guests milling around in the courtyard area and the best they had to offer was Mexican folk dancing. One night was kids night, they recruited children out of the audience to come up on stage and sing. Come on! Almost every other aspect of this resort was great, but whoever is in charge of entertainment should be fired. RIU Tequila (a 10 minute walk) has Pinata open from 2300-0200, but a resort like this deserves it's own club. Overall I'd say the best food of the all-inclusives I've been to. Krystal is not to be missed. They have the same type of dinner reservation system that a lot of the resorts use (go to the lobby between 1200-1500 and make up to 2 nights worth of reservations). Seating choices are 6:30 or 8:45. A little tipping goes a long way, hint, hint. Beach was great, lots of chairs under the shady palms. Pool was not huge, and they only have one which got pretty warm and oily by the afternoon but I go more for the beach so was not a problem. As you'll read, the hallways are tiled and get pretty noisy at night but the hotel is well constructed, you never hear your neighbors once their door slams. For whatever reason female guests seemed to outnumber the men 5-to-1. The hotel is located within Playacar so every car coming in has to show ID. The only folks walking the sidewalks at night are other tourists like yourself, I didn't see a single sketchy character. Arrange a trip or grab some snorkel gear and a cab to Akumal Bay. Saw more sea turtles than we could count and they are oblivious to the snorkelers.
reviews.title: A Really Good Resort, Could Be Great If..........
Wow, great service, food, beach and pool
reviews.text: I use Trip Advisor religiously before going on trips and found that many of the people I met use it as well. After reading many many reviews, I can't understand how anyone could complain about the food or service. We were treated like royalty (tip or not) These servers are WELL TRAINED and beat out any server in an American resteraunt. The food was good and plentiful, but yes does get old after 5 days, as does anything else when you are away from home.

reviews.title: Pure Amazement
reviews.text: The rooms were very nice, however for a hotel of this quality I would like to see more comfortable beds and linens. The bed was not very comfortable, but wasn't horrible either. However, the roll away we had brought in for our 3rd person in each room was horrible. The linens are outdated; I love the new duvets the Marriotts and others are using now.
About the smell. Yes, we brought it home as well. Didn't really notice it while there - guess we got used to the humid, beachy smell.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Experience

reviews.text: The rooms are very dangerous! My husband took a terrrible fall on the slippery tile and we were lucky he was able to get up again. Actually knocked the breath out of him. WEAR RUBBER SOLED SHOES IN THE ROOM! If I go back, I will just ask the cleaning staff NOT to mop the floors. Takes forever to dry with humidity.
reviews.title: Sun, Fun, and Total Relaxation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just back from a 2 week break, had an amazing holiday. On arrival we got a free upgrade. All the restaurant food was amazing, we never waited long to be served, each restaurant had two sitting 18:30 & 20:45. I always laugh as the Americans alway find something to complain about mostly its about being ill, well if the didn't spent all day drinking around the swim up bar or the sports bar, maybe the would enjoy the meals at night.
reviews.title: Amazing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have recently returned from a tour and stay in Mexico with my boyfriend...we did a combo 7 night tour with 7 night stay...and when we booked it this was the only hotel option. But what an option!!!We spent our second week here relaxing after the tour and I can honestly say it was one of the nicest hotels ive ever stayed in. The building is very modern but decorated with furniture similar to a stately home in England...the staff are fantastic...so friendly and helpful. The location is great, with a lovely beach with tons of sun loungers. Everything is so new and clean...we used the spa whilst we stayed there which I would highly recommend. The food is fantastic....we tried 2 of the specialist restaurants...Krystal and The Japanese one...which were both excellent. I cannot fault this hotel...the only slight complaint would be that the room did seem a bit damp all week...which i think is due to the cleaner mopping it everyday with no ventilation...so it had a funny musty smell...BUT If you are staying in this area...Riu Palace Riviera Maya everytime!!!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel...A true palace

reviews.text: I stayed at the Riu Palace Riviera Maya with my dad and 15 year old sister (I am 23) from June 24-July 1. We all had a great time. Below is a 100% honest review of the hotel & the area.
reviews.title: Fantastic Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival, we were greeted with fruity drinks and given a map of the hotel and grounds at the front desk. Our bags were promptly taken to our room. We had a junior suite facing in towards the grounds and it was beautiful. Very clean. I can only say that the some parts of the bathroom, such as the mirror and inside of the shower, were a little dated and could use some sprucing up. Also, the beds were a little hard for our taste. None of us experienced a musty smell that some other reviews talked about. Our room was cleaned everyday, however we did not receive the turn-down service every night, I'd say only 2 nights we received it. But we did tip our maid for the week the very last day and not every day during the week, so that may be why.
reviews.title: If you like 3 star Hotels with Watered Down Alcohol, choose this one

reviews.text: The restaurants were excellent. We ate at each one of them and it was nice because eating at the buffet every day is just too much. When you're inside the restaurants, you really feel like you're in another place so it definitely is a nice change. We loved the japanese and brazilian place the best. As for making reservations, yes there was a line, depending on what time you got there. If you get there a little before 12 pm, you'll probably wait in line for 15 minutes the most. It just depends what time and how many people are waiting that day. You can make reservations for two days in advance. I honestly did not have a problem with the reservation system.
reviews.title: Alright for a one time visit to Mexico

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything was excellent. Rooms very clean, food as you would expect from an all inclusive. Beach was being improved while we were there. Was a great neighboorhood for running/walking outside resort, very safe.
reviews.title: A great getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there from July 5-11 in Room-1057. The room was great, beautiful view of entire grounds from the ocean to the main court ward. Sweet and short AINT BROKEN DON’T FIX IT, this is our 3rd time with in a year to this hotel. You can find cheaper, but you will not experience the excellence of the
reviews.title: EXCELLENT

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: RIU PALACE RIVIERA MAYA, all around quality. We are scheduled to meet friends that we met here last November this coming October, 4th time within a year. Don’t take a chance, it really is a great place.
reviews.title: I've never been so spoiled!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thanks to all the staff
reviews.title: Fantastic Luxurious Holiday

reviews.text: Arrival: We arrived over 7 hours late - Thank You US Airways... However, the front desk staff handed us our fruity beverage and we spent no more than 3 minutes checking in. Was so easy I was shocked. My advice... pay for a private transfer to and from the airport/hotel. We booked thru FunJet, it was maybe another $50/person. So worth it. Our 45/55 minutes of driving was only driving, no stopping at other hotels.
reviews.title: An excellent vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 2 weeks in March. Hotel room was very spacious with large double bed and a seating area. The food was amazing and such good quality, beef wellington, lobster on more than one occasion. A La Carte restaurants also but the food was so good in the buffet we chose to eat in those. The only thing I could say that were negative points were that the evening entertainment finished quite early and the rooms had quite big gaps under the doors and you could hear every word people said as they were walking down the corridors past your room. All in all an excellent hotel and I would go there again.
reviews.title: Fantastic food, hotel, entertainment good be better, rooms a bit noisey.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this is simply the best hotel we have ever stayed in. The service was world class, as soon as your glass was empty the waiters were there with a refill. Beautiful room spotlessly clean. Excellent choice of food and restaurants. 24 hour all inclusive, faultless.
reviews.title: Fantasic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the surface the hotel is gorgeous. Unfortunately the service is poor, if you are looking for high service quality this hotel IS NOT FOR YOU. Based on my discussions with other guests, it apparently could alway be worse, however this is how it goes: Day 1: Cockaroach in bathroom-STAFF SAID SORRY THIS IS THE JUNGLE! Day 2: creepy crawlies around fridge, maid spraid Raid! Day 3: poured during wedding and being in the wedding party we begged for towels and umbrella, BUT bc we didn't have our towel key/room key we WERE TOLD NO!! Wasn't our soaked brides's wedding dress enough? Day 4: INTERNET WAS DOWN, oh well. By the way, the hotel is roughly one hour away from airport.
reviews.title: All glitz no glam...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort was one of three we visited during our two week stay in the Mayan Riviera this year. We were pleasantly surprised with the excellent service and food quality this resort offers. Excellent location also. Instead of going over everything that others have already said I posted a large photo album of the resort for your consideration,
reviews.title: Great Value

reviews.text: http://www.surfnorthwest.com/riu/index.htm
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

aka: Riu Palace Riviera Maya Hotel Playa Del Carmen
